intro: Tetranthera racemosa, commonly known as the clustered spider-plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a dense, racemose inflorescence, giving it its species name. Its leaves are typically narrow and linear, with a somewhat succulent texture. Tetranthera racemosa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and ease of care.
